intro: Alectra thyrsoidea, commonly known as the yellow sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in desert or semi-desert environments. It has narrow, linear leaves and a sprawling growth habit, often forming mats or low shrubs. Alectra thyrsoidea is adapted to arid conditions and is drought-tolerant, making it a hardy plant in xerophytic ecosystems.
